concise_definition: n. 侮辱, 冒犯; v. 侮辱, 冒犯

definitions.explanation_en: An offensive or disrespectful remark or action intended to demean, humiliate, or show contempt for someone.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指有意贬低、羞辱或表现出对某人蔑视的冒犯性言辞或行为。
definitions.example_en: His comment about her accent was a clear insult to her cultural background.
definitions.example_cn: 他关于她口音的评论是对她文化背景的明显侮辱。

definitions.explanation_en: To treat someone with disrespect or contempt through words or actions, causing them to feel offended or humiliated.
definitions.explanation_cn: 通过言语或行为以不尊重或蔑视的态度对待某人，使其感到被冒犯或羞辱。
definitions.example_en: She felt insulted when he refused to shake her hand.
definitions.example_cn: 当他拒绝与她握手时，她感到受到了侮辱。

definitions.explanation_en: To offer something as a gesture that is perceived as offensive or condescending, often unintentionally.
definitions.explanation_cn: 以一种被视作冒犯或居高临下的方式提供某物，有时是无意的。
definitions.example_en: Giving a used gift to a guest can easily be seen as insulting.
definitions.example_cn: 把用过的礼物送给客人很容易被视为一种侮辱。

comparison.analysis: “Offend” (冒犯) 范围更广，指任何引起不快、愤怒或不适的行为或言论，不一定带有贬低意图。而 “insult” 更强调主观的蔑视和贬低，具有更强的恶意和针对性。
“Abuse” (虐待/辱骂) 通常指持续性的、系统性的言语或身体攻击，程度更严重，常涉及权力不对等。而 “insult” 通常是单次、短暂的言语攻击，虽具伤害性但未必构成持续压迫。
“Slight” (轻视/怠慢) 指因忽视、冷落或不重视而造成的轻微冒犯，往往更含蓄、间接。而 “insult” 是直接、明确的贬低行为，意图更明显，情感冲击更强。
